title: Decoy Country Park Walking Route

images.title: Paul Hutchinson / Decoy Country Park
images.caption: A view to the south across the water sports landing area towards some of the surrounding woodland. Once a clay quarry, Decoy Country Park provides a children's play area, water sports lake, and deciduous woodland trails.

images.title: Derek Harper / Beech woodland west of Decoy Lake
images.caption: Beech woodland west of Decoy Lake. These beeches are close to the western edge of the woodland.

images.title: Derek Harper / Pond near Decoy Lake
images.caption: Pond near Decoy Lake. Iris sprouting out of a swampy area of the woodland west of the lake.

images.title: Derek Harper / Blackball Plantation
images.caption: Blackball Plantation. Seen from Newton Abbot Footpath 1. On the southern side of the park.

images.title: paul dickson / Nuthatch at Decoy Country Park
images.caption: Nuthatch at the park. Looking from bird viewing area where this nuthatch is burying a peanut for later into the clay soil. The country Park used to be a ball clay area helping to produce the finest porceline. The ponds being the pits left behind after clay extraction.

description: This is a short walk around the delightful Decoy Country Park in Newton Abbot, Devon. You will pass around the lake and then onto a series of peaceful woodland trails before returning to the start point at the car park. The park includes a Wildlife Discovery Centre, Nature Reserve and a watersports centre. It's located just to the south of the town centre and not far from the train station. To continue your walking in the town try our Newton Abbot Walk. This takes you north from the town along the Stover Canal, leading you to the lovely Stover Country Park .

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: There's an on site kiosk where you can pick up drinks, snacks and light bites.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woodland and parkland trails are perfect for dog walking so you'll probably see other owners on your visit.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: One nice idea is to head north and pick up the River Teign Walk. You could follow this riverside path east towards Shaldon on the coast and then visit the lovely Labrador Bay RSPB reserve. The River Lemon Walk can be picked up just to the north of the park. The pleasant riverside trail will take you pass the National Trust's Bradley Manor which you can find on the western side of Newton Abbot, about a mile from the park. The medieval limestone manor house has an interesting history and some pleasant trails through the adjacent Bradley Woods. For more walking ideas in the area see the Devon Walks page.

display_address: Decoy Country Park, Milber, Newton Abbot, Abbotskerswell, Teignbridge, Devon, England, TQ12 1EP, United Kingdom
